entry.title: Combined summary - Concern about "Inscriptions"
entry.summary: The topic of discussion is block sizes. One misconception is that storage is the main issue, but this is not true. To gain more insight, a helpful resource is a talk given a few years ago, accessible at this link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CqNEQS80-h4&t=7s. GamedevAlice shares their thoughts on the Bitcoin development mailing list. It's important to approach these discussions with a solid understanding.The question of whether blockchain storage is sufficient can be answered with a 'yes' based on several factors. In a worst-case scenario, with a maximum block size of 4MB and a block time of 10 minutes, the growth would be 210.24GB per year. Currently, the entire blockchain is around 500GB, showing significant growth potential. However, a 5TB hard drive can be obtained for less than $150, providing storage that would last 21 years before running out of space. This costs less than $0.02 per day, making it manageable even in the worst-case scenario.Additionally, hardware costs decrease over time, reducing the burden of storage costs. Efforts are being made to optimize data storage by individual nodes. One initiative is Floresta, a node implementation that uses utreexo to enable nodes to operate without maintaining the full UTXO set. This, along with other initiatives, reduces the amount of space required by individual nodes. Overall, affordable hardware and ongoing optimization efforts ensure that storage remains sufficient for practical usage.
